alert.note: Alert for Coke; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 5:49PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Coke and north central Tom Green Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 548 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Robert Lee, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Robert Lee, Orient, Water Valley and The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
